Parameters:

scale - how much you want to scale the image .
rot - Rotation about axis . rot.x is the rotation about x-axis similarly for other axes
Returns:
It returns the transformgroup that has loaded obj file as child .

createBox_with_material_properites

public Group createBox_with_material_properites(Vector3d pos,
                                                Vector3d scale,
                                                Vector3d rot,
                                                Color3f ambientColor,
                                                Color3f emissiveColor,
                                                Color3f diffuseColor,
                                                Color3f specularColor,
                                                float shininess)
This will create box with material properites. The Material object defines the appearance of an object under illumination. If the Material object in an Appearance object is null, lighting is disabled for all nodes that use that Appearance object. The properties that can be set for a Material object are:

Parameters:
pos - position of the center of the box
scale - Scaling
rot - rotation about 3-axes
ambientColor - the ambient RGB color reflected off the surface of the material. The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default ambient color is (0.2, 0.2, 0.2).
emissiveColor - the RGB color of the light the material emits, if any. The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default emissive color is (0.0, 0.0, 0.0).
diffuseColor - the RGB color of the material when illuminated. The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default diffuse color is (1.0, 1.0, 1.0).
specularColor - the RGB specular color of the material (highlights). The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default specular color is (1.0, 1.0, 1.0).
shininess - the material's shininess, in the range [1.0, 128.0] with 1.0 being not shiny and 128.0 being very shiny. Values outside this range are clamped. The default value for the material's shininess is 64.
Returns:
it returns Transformgroup that has box as a child

createCylinder

public Group createCylinder(float r,
                            float h,
                            Vector3d pos,
                            Vector3d scale,
                            Vector3d rot,
                            Color3f colr,
                            java.lang.String id,
                            java.util.HashMap hmap)
It creates cylinder default cylinder of radius of 1.0 and height of 2.0.

Parameters:
r - radius of cylinder
h - height of cylinder
pos - position of the center of the cylinder
scale - scaling
rot - rotation about the axes
colr - Color of the cylinder
id - hash id
hmap - Hashmap
Returns:
Transformation group that has cylinder as child

createCylinderWithMatProp

public Group createCylinderWithMatProp(Vector3d pos,
                                       Vector3d scale,
                                       Vector3d rot,
                                       Color3f colr,
                                       Color3f ambientColor,
                                       Color3f emissiveColor,
                                       Color3f diffuseColor,
                                       Color3f specularColor,
                                       float shininess,
                                       java.util.HashMap hm,
                                       java.lang.String str)
This will create cylinder with material properites. The Material object defines the appearance of an object under illumination. If the Material object in an Appearance object is null, lighting is disabled for all nodes that use that Appearance object. The properties that can be set for a Material object are:

Parameters:
pos - position of the center of the cylinder
scale - Scaling
rot - rotation about 3-axes
ambientColor - the ambient RGB color reflected off the surface of the material. The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default ambient color is (0.2, 0.2, 0.2).
emissiveColor - the RGB color of the light the material emits, if any. The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default emissive color is (0.0, 0.0, 0.0).
diffuseColor - the RGB color of the material when illuminated. The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default diffuse color is (1.0, 1.0, 1.0).
specularColor - the RGB specular color of the material (highlights). The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default specular color is (1.0, 1.0, 1.0).
shininess - the material's shininess, in the range [1.0, 128.0] with 1.0 being not shiny and 128.0 being very shiny. Values outside this range are clamped. The default value for the material's shininess is 64.
colr - color of the cylinder
hm - Hashmap
str - Hashkey
Returns:
it returns Transformgroup that has cylinder with material properties as child

createSphere

public Group createSphere(Vector3d pos,
                          float radius,
                          Color3f ambient,
                          Color3f emissive,
                          Color3f diffuse,
                          Color3f specular,
                          float shine)
This will create sphere The Material object defines the appearance of an object under illumination. If the Material object in an Appearance object is null, lighting is disabled for all nodes that use that Appearance object. The properties that can be set for a Material object are:

Parameters:
pos - position of the center of the cylinder
radius - Radius of the sphere
rot - rotation about 3-axes
ambient - the ambient RGB color reflected off the surface of the material. The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default ambient color is (0.2, 0.2, 0.2).
emissive - the RGB color of the light the material emits, if any. The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default emissive color is (0.0, 0.0, 0.0).
diffuse - the RGB color of the material when illuminated. The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default diffuse color is (1.0, 1.0, 1.0).
specular - the RGB specular color of the material (highlights). The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default specular color is (1.0, 1.0, 1.0).
shine - the material's shininess, in the range [1.0, 128.0] with 1.0 being not shiny and 128.0 being very shiny. Values outside this range are clamped. The default value for the material's shininess is 64.
Returns:
it returns Transformgroup that has Sphere with material properties as child

createSphere1

public Group createSphere1(Vector3d pos,
                           Vector3d scale,
                           float radius,
                           Color3f ambient,
                           Color3f emissive,
                           Color3f diffuse,
                           Color3f specular,
                           float shine,
                           java.lang.String str,
                           java.util.HashMap hm)
creates the sphere with material properties that can be stored in the hash map

Parameters:
pos - Position of the center of the Sphere
scale - Scaling
radius - Radius of the sphere
ambient - the ambient RGB color reflected off the surface of the material. The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default ambient color is (0.2, 0.2, 0.2).
emissive - the RGB color of the light the material emits, if any. The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default emissive color is (0.0, 0.0, 0.0).
diffuse - the RGB color of the material when illuminated. The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default diffuse color is (1.0, 1.0, 1.0).
specular - the RGB specular color of the material (highlights). The range of values is 0.0 to 1.0. The default specular color is (1.0, 1.0, 1.0).
shine - the material's shininess, in the range [1.0, 128.0] with 1.0 being not shiny and 128.0 being very shiny. Values outside this range are clamped. The default value for the material's shininess is 64.
str - Hash id
hm - Hash map in which you want store the sphere object
Returns:
It returns the transformation group that has the required sphere as child

public Group createtrep(Vector3d pos,

                        float ydisp,
                        float xrightdisp,
                        Color3f colr,
                        java.lang.String texfile,
                        java.lang.String id,
                        java.util.HashMap hmap)
creates Trapizium

Parameters:
pos - Center of the trapizium
scale - Scaling
rot - rotation about axes
xleftdisp - how much displacemet you want along left side of x-axis more than correspondin the parallel side
ydisp - how much displacemet you want along y-axis more than corresponding the parallel side
xrightdisp - how much displacemet you want along left side of x-axis more than the correspondin parallel side
colr - color of the trapizum
texfile - Image path of the texure
id - Hash key
hmap - HashMap in which you want to store this trapizium object
Returns:
It returns transformation group that has Trapizium as Child \

createBoxGeom

public Geometry createBoxGeom(float top,
                              float botm)
//Return one of the 8 corner points. The points are numbered as follows: // // (m,x,m) (x,x,m) // ------------------------------ // /| 6 /| 7 // / | / | // / | / | // / | / | // / | / | // / | / | // / | / | // / | / | // / | / | /(m,x,m)/ 3 | (x,x,x) / | // /----------------------------/ 2 | // | | | | // | | | | +Y // | (m,m,m)) | 5 | | 8 // | |-----------------|----------| | // | / | /(x,m,m)| // | / | / | -Z // | / | / | // | / | / | / // | / | / | / // | / | / | / // | / | / | / // | / | / | / // | / | / |/ // |/ |/ ----------------- +X // ------------------------------ // (m,m,x) 4 (x,m,x) 1 //

createBoxGeom

                              float top,
                              float botm)
